Red Faction: Armageddon is shorter than Red Faction: Guerrilla. I clocked at 8,5 hours. Not counting the extra gamemodes and getting all achievements, plus playing the multiplayer which I will not cover.

Red Faction: Armageddon is a linear third person shooter, with the destruction mechanics of the previous title Guerrilla.
You play as a member of the famous Mason family, getting into trouble. This trouble is a new kind of alien life form hidden in the planet Mars. You will use different futuristic weapons of personal destruction to get things done.

From melee to rocket launchers, from ground to air vehicles, all is a fun way to do what Masons do best.

|Good stuff:
-Well optimised.
-The graphics are beautiful. Environments are well designed to fit the mood of that current level.
-Geo-mod is back in good shape with better optimised performance when there is allot of detailed destruction around.
-Main character has more personality than his ancestor Alex Mason in the previous game.
-Support character for Mason (also seems to grow with the main character).
-Repair the environment when you need it, or use it against enemies (to make cover etc).
-Collectibles.
-Level variation (big and small levels).
-Enemy variation.
-Weapon variation.
-Upgrade system.
-Decent length singleplayer.

|Not really:
-Story seems to have plot holes.
-Could Bastion not have been a hub to get upgrades etc?
-That's really it from what I can remember.

|Rating:
8 of 10 should be good (for singleplayer only).

The game itself is decent, but taking free-roam out of the equation has ruined the fun in this game almost completely. The best thing about Guerilla (apart from the destruction itself), was the freedom that I can run around in an open world and destroy whatever I like. This has been taken out of the game, and it really feels empty now. Besides, the story isn't even that great, and I'm sick of shooting bugs off of a wall.

Well, do you remember the beauty of destruction? Blow of wind in your face while dashing around rocks of Mars, the feeling of freedom and choice, as to where you go and what you blow up? The series of interesting and fun to play challenges?

Well this game has none of it.

It had potential to be a marvelous continuation of an awesome game, but instead, it got callofdutyfied. The game is linear, plot is boring, the main character even more so.
The only fun part of the game IMO is the magnet gun. That's it.

Would not buy again.
was pretty dam fan. 7/10

This was an alright game, nothing really that spectacular.  The gameplay is linear once again, breaking away from the open world of Guerrilla.  The destruction element is still there, but less so than any other Red Faction game I remember. You still get to tear down buildings, but now it seems that many of them are mission objectives that are placed intentionally. The weapons are fairly creative and fun to use, I really liked the gravity gun.  Storywise, I didn't feel like it tied into any of the other releases in the franchise, like they could have easily taken all the Red Faction names and characters out of the game and it wouldn't have changed things at all.   Amusing for a playthrough, but not really memorable.\n\n5/10

This is a criminally underrated game. Again, because of the B-level of the Red Faction franchise as a whole, I suspect players and reviewers went into Armageddon already thinking it was going to suck. Well, that's the wrong expectation to have if you want to enjoy something, and, quite frankly, it doesn't suck. It just doesn't measure up to Guerilla, due to it being a linear Third Person Shooter that takes you to the opressive caverns beneath the surface of Mars. So, no, it's not better then Guerilla. It is, however, much better then Red Factions 1 and 2, and if you were engaged in Guerilla's plot and have seen the Origins film that ties these two games together, you will have sympathy for the Mason family and their plight, and will enjoy the game that much more. At a basic level, it has an array of satisfyingly destructive weaponry and even allows you to reconstruct destroyed buildings with the NanoForge device- so you can blow them up all over again. There's also co-op survival.
Tear It Down

Great game. great graphics and the destructable nature of much of the objects in the game gives the environment a feeling of interactivity that is missing in other games, which have environments that feel painted on.

Tired of shooting your enemies but realizing that you couldn't harm a pettle on a petunia with a so called nuclear weapon( aka Starcraft)? In Red Faction you can blow up almost everything, and its very satisfying.

The game is campy and cheesy and reminded me of Total Recall a bit, if the main role was played by Vin Deisel. Your character is cleary made of something a lot tougher than flesh and bone. Running around the extremely dangerous caves of Mars wearing a tank top and some military trousers some good boots and a few good weapons is apparently all it takes to stop a planet wide infestation of alien monsters.

As far as games go this one is top notch. great weapons, great vehicles, great nano-technology, lots of RPG-like power up, solid story, good acting for a game, suitable anxious/intense/ominous/highly urgent music, no weakenesses that I can see. The game has good replaybility as well.

reviewText: Red Faction: Armageddon is a pretty good game but sadly not recommended. With an uninteresting story line and a typical third person shooter, there's pretty much nothing else do in the game. Sure you can upgrade your weapons and your super awesome wristband fixer ♥♥♥♥ and also you can break stuff around you with Volition's awesome Geo Mod 2.5 physics engine and see things break and explode to pieces and then fixing it all up, but other then that the characters are just not interesting enough to even care about them. It's just over the top action pack, one man army against an alien hoard to save his people from being eaten and to kill the men who started all this, that's pretty much story. But it has some memorable parts like a Red Faction 1 references like there's this one time the main character will talk about some Martian Revolution or the Miner Uprising and Ultor the head of the mining complex and some other ♥♥♥♥ like that, bring back some pretty good memories. But you just can't beat the first Red Faction not even Red Faction Gurilla or Red Faction 2 can beat the first Red Faction but Red Faction 2 ain't all that bad but still can't beat Red Faction 1. I suggest getting it when it's really cheap it's just not worth paying $20 for this  game.

Red Faction: Guerrilla with rebuilding to pair with the fun of disintegration, bright colors, new vehicles, and new game+, what could go wrong? Answer: a shooter on rails with level after level in caves and spider monster/aliens instead of human-appearance enemies. The moments of fun are drowned out by the boring-repetetive fights where there is next to no destructable environment and enemies that don't offer anything more than using the same gravity-gun style shrapnel battles over and over. Tearing down the floor doesn't do much when the enemies crawl on the ceiling. The use of charge mechanics further draws out the monotony with adding pauses between fights.

You won't find this in any review but I very much thought this game was the peak of the series. It took them 4 games to create the engaging, visceral, destructive experience they were going for here and with the culmination of all of the lessons they have learnt, Violition has managed to create the most empowering third person shooter ever. Stasis in this game makes Isaac Clarke look like a noob, it not just stops enemies but drains their health and replenishes yours. The Mechs from F.E.A.R. were awesome? Nope, they cant quite charge through a wall, crush all the enemies in the way and cause the building they just went through to collapse. What's a gravity gun again? The Magnet gun is my favourite gun ever (along side the Portal Gun). This is the power-fantasy any crazy like me has been waiting for. Sniper shooting at you? Shoot a magnet at the base and another at the roof. The base flies upwards into the roof and the whole thing implodes and then collapses. Survive that! Boss fights consist of throwing the boss around the enviroment or pieces of the environment at them until they are impaled by debris and their body parts scatter with a gratifying splat. The campaign does get tedious towards the end though, with one long mission underground with no destructible environments and the story takes itself more seriously than I can. But Horde mode and a free form destroy everything 'Ruin Mode' provides some online fun. Valve better start working on Half Life 3 or everyone is just gonna rip off the old games and forget about them. R.I.P. Gravity Gun.
It's a fun game both single and multiplayer :D Fast action guaranteed.

reviewText: I was very surprised with how much I enjoyed Armageddon, I had not heard alot and wasn't expecting much.\nBut this game really mixed it up, Guerrilla was a free-roam open world shooter, where you can destroy everything in sight, which was a fun game but as with most sandbox games its primary story was not as enjoyable as it could've been. This does away with all the sandbox elements and sticks to a more linear campaign based shooter. This works very well, the destruction is much more fun as sometimes its required to progress and your primary in buildings rather then standing outside killing everyone with thermobaric rocket launchers. The guns are very fun, the upgrade system is great and it has a horde type up to 4 player co-op wave mode. OVerall the game is an excellent package, it has much nice graphics then Guerrilla and runs alot nicer then Guerrilla did on release. Alot of fun whether you or not you enjoyed Guerrilla!

If there's one thing I like about Red Faction games, it's the physics engine. In Armageddon, nearly everything can be blown into smithereens; the amount of destructible environment is mind boggling. Add some incredibly fun weaponry and this is a no brainer for any shooter fans.
Genuinely, this isn't a bad game at all. Definitely the most destructable game on the market. The story is excellent, and even if you have a ♥♥♥♥ PC, this game will run no problem.

Red Faction: Armageddon, like its predecessor (Guerrilla), proudly flaunts its massively destructible environment. The player can tear down any building he so wishes and in this new (and perhaps final) iteration of THQ's long running franchise, buildings can now be restored. But is this gimmick enough?

Manipulating buildings isn't the sole gameplay at work here. Armageddon is a third person shooter that plays similarly to any typical third person shooter in the market. Even more generic is its plot that revolves around the uprising of an alien species that threatens human life on Mars.

My biggest grievances though are the removal of Guerrilla's open world. As a consequence, Armageddon is a very linear affair. That's not to say it isn't a blast, but more freedom might have made the game much more engaging.

Armageddon isn't Game of the Year" material
date: but I'd be lying if I said it wasn't fun. Just demolishing buildings in this game may be worth the admission price.\n\nGrade: B"

Very solid game and in my opinion a big improvement over the original entry into this series Red Faction Guerrilla. The destruction engine they use was improved a lot and it is quite fun to play around with their version of the gravity gun. The inclusion of an expandable skill tree gives the game some flexibility on how you play and can be fun to customize your character to play how you want. The only really noticeable low point of this game is the story witch is bad even by video game standards.

As a whole the game is worth checking out if you can get it for under 10$; it will give you a solid 9 hours of play.

reviewText: Despite the fact that I have never played any of the other Red Faction games, I love this title. The story is very captivating and I love the large array of weapons that you can choose from. This game seems to always keep me on my feet, shooting aliens here, one there, it is constantly making me energetic. I have only put 2 hours into the game and I have only reached 20% of the entire story mode, which means that there is a fairly long story. Even after I get done with the single player campaign, there is 2 OTHER multi-player modes that I can play. The graphics look very crisp and nice. I like how (most) the world is fully destructable, using my Maul I can tear down walls or any various obsticles that stand in my way. I will probably find myself playing this game when I complete it again because this is a very nice title. I am concidering playing the other Red Faction games because people have said that this was the game that ruined the entire series. I don't know what made this game so much worse for the Red Faction series. I like to play shooters and adventure titles, this was a very nice game for me to pick up, it is a 3rd person action adventure shooter title that takes place in the future years. I am not extremely far in the story yet so I don't exactly have a really good standpoint as to what's going on in the game's storyline. I would reccomend this to someone who hasn't played any other Red Faction titles because it seems to me that Red Faction players seem to hate this game. The game really doesn't seem that repetative to me, but sometimes it can be. It's not as bad as Dead Island but it can get that way sometimes. I don't die normally, I have only died once and that was on accident. I have the difficutly at Normal setting so if it were me, I'd set it to hard or something above Normal for someone looking for a little harder AI to fight against. I'd give this game a rough 8.9/10 it's a great title if you want a 3rd person shooter kind of like Gears of War.

Going to keep this one simple. This is, and always has been my favourite game on the Xbox, and now it's on Steam I've fallen for it again! Once you complete the amazingly fun and action packed story, not only is there additional DLC, but this games campaign has such awesome replayability that you don't get bored!
Also, the multiplayer (1-4) is just as much fun and has kept me entertained for hours on the console! Play with up to 3 of your friends in 'Infestation' and either play survival (waves of fun) or defend areas from attack. There is also a game mode called 'Ruin' where you can literally just take your time destroying the environment, or cause as much destruction as possible within one minute. Also, you can transfer abilities from the story over to the multiplayer!

The amount of weaponry and gear at your disposal is awesome, and the fact that you can not only interact (destroy) your environment, but you can then repair the environment too with the Nano Forge and the help of S.A.M (your Situational Awareness Module). Another point to raise is the fact that the Nano Forge, weaponry and armour are all upgradeable which means there is no linear path to follow, however you can choose which path to take.

If i was EVER to give a game 10/10, this is it.

10/10.
